Utterance: Hi! It’s lovely to see you again. How have you been this past week?
I’ve been good! I stuck to my goal of dedicating time to my personal project.
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to set aside that time for yourself?
It felt great! I was able to get a lot done, and I even experimented with some new techniques.
Wonderful! Trying new techniques can be a great way to grow as an artist. What did you experiment with?
I played around with lighting and angles. It opened up a new perspective for me.
That’s exciting! It sounds like you’re really embracing the creative process. How did you feel about the results?
I was pleasantly surprised! Some of the shots turned out better than I expected.
That’s a great feeling. Celebrating those small victories can help keep you motivated. Have you had a chance to share any of your new work with anyone?
Yes, I shared some photos with my friend who’s an artist, and she gave me some positive feedback.
That’s wonderful! Getting feedback from peers can be very encouraging. How did it feel to share your growth with her?
It felt validating. I’m starting to feel more confident about my work.
That’s a significant step forward. Confidence can really enhance your creative expression. Have you thought about how to continue building that confidence in your photography?
I think I want to keep challenging myself with new projects and techniques.
That’s a great plan. Setting challenges can help you grow and expand your skills. Have you set any new goals for your photography?
I want to create a series that tells a story about my transition to LA.
That sounds like a compelling concept. Storytelling through photography can be very impactful. How do you envision structuring this series?
I’m thinking of capturing different aspects of my life here, like the people I meet and the places I visit.
That’s a beautiful way to document your journey. Have you started brainstorming ideas for specific shots or themes?
Yes! I’ve been jotting down ideas and locations that resonate with me.
That’s a productive approach. It’s great that you’re actively engaging with your creative process. How do you feel about the direction your work is taking?
I feel excited and a little nervous. It’s a bit vulnerable to share my personal story.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: It’s completely natural to feel that way. Vulnerability can lead to powerful connections with your audience. Have you thought about how you might handle any fears of judgment?
I guess I’ll remind myself that everyone has their own story, and mine is just as valid.
That’s a healthy perspective. Embracing your unique experiences can help you connect with others. Is there anything else you want to explore today?
I’d like to discuss how to handle criticism, especially since I’m putting my work out there.
That’s a great topic. Have you faced criticism in the past, and how did you handle it?
I have, and it stung at first. I took it personally, but I’ve learned to separate myself from the work.
That’s a valuable lesson. Learning to separate yourself from your art can help you grow. Would it help to view criticism as constructive feedback rather than a personal attack?
Yes, I think that would help. I want to grow, not feel defeated.
Absolutely. Viewing feedback as an opportunity for growth can be empowering. Would you like to set a goal for how to approach feedback moving forward?
I’ll try to remind myself to consider the feedback objectively and see if there’s something I can learn from it.
That sounds like a solid goal. Remember, every artist faces criticism, and it’s part of the journey. Thank you for sharing your thoughts today.
Thank you! I feel like I’m making progress.
You are! I look forward to hearing more about your journey next time.
Bye!
Bye!
